content:
The following resources have substantive change due dates today:

AllergyIntolerance, CarePlan, CareTeam, Composition, Condition, Device, DiagnosticReport, Goal, GuidanceResponse, Immunization, Location, Medication, MedicationAdministration, MedicationDispense, MedicationOrder, MedicationStatement, Observation, Organization, Patient, Practitioner, Procedure, ServiceDefinition

@Eric Haas @Brian Postlethwaite @Michelle (Moseman) Miller @Melva Peters - can you comment please?
I have applied all substantiative changes to FHIR-I resources that are approved and that are going to happen for the December milestone

Hi @Grahame Grieve We have 1 change remaining for the workflow harmonization for medicationrequest and are just starting on harmonization of event resources. The 2 approved changes that are waiting to be applied are non-substantive. Can you confirm which tracker items you believe are due today?
I didn't look at tracker items, and don't have any particular ones listed.

The short answer is that I've applied everything that I could prior to the Dec freeze.

Here is the list of remaining Patient Care WG "Resolved-Change Required" issues that are substantive changes, but not yet applied:

High Priority Resources:

  • GF#8931 - new condition extension (should get applied prior to STU3)
  • GF#10028 - may need to update gForge status to deferred (resolution said "This profile would not be developed for this release cycle")
  • GF#10293 - apply workflow patterns - need to review again with PCWG given changes to workflow patterns
  • GF#11020 - intentionally waiting to apply until larger AllergyIntolerance.reaction discussions land
  • GF#11023 - intentionally waiting to apply until larger AllergyIntolerance.reaction discussions land
  • GF#11354 - intentionally waiting to apply until AllergyIntolerance discussions land (controversial resolution being revisited)

Lower Priority Resources:

  • GF#10468 - @Lloyd McKenzie agreed to apply this Questionnaire change after he returns from his vacation
  • GF#12173 - new Questionnaire extension (should get applied prior to STU3)
@Eric Haas "no" - no there are no changes , or no, I still have change?

no I still have not made the substantive changes and no we have not voted on many of the substantive comments.

Observation:

10117 add Sequence as a target for Observation.related (Bob Milius) Persuasive
10275 add valueBoolean to Observation (Andrew Ross) Persuasive
11115 Do not unbound referenceRange.meaning - use two elements instead. - 2016-09 core #269 (Danielle Friend) Persuasive
10344 Alignment of DiagnosticReport.status and Observation.status ValueSets (Alexander Henket) Persuasive with Mod
10299 Ensure event resource data elements align with event resource template (Eric Haas) Persuasive
10300 align event resource statuses to event resource template (Eric Haas) Persuasive
not going to make the milestone then
I'm working on the 20 aproved PA changes to get through today.
I can knokc most of these out, but not all

To clarify, Patient Care still has ~30 unresolved tracker issues for our prioritized resources. Thus, it shouldn't hold up the Dec freeze, but there will be more substantive changes to those resources after the Dec freeze, prior to STU3 freeze in Feb.

Similar comment to Michelle's for Pharmacy. We have 27 tracker items that are unresoled at this point including continued harmonization of resources to request and event logical models. Some of these will result in substantive changes to resources after the December freeze but prior to the STU3 freeze in February.
